priorVersion.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTESTCD

self.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name.

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ALT", "LDH".
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name.
datasetVariables.name: LBTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C67154

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Alanine Aminotransferase", "Lactate Dehydrogenase".
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: LBTEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C102580

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: LBSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: LBSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBNRIND

datasetVariables.description:
1. Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW".
2. Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results.
3. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
datasetVariables.label: Reference Range Indicator
datasetVariables.name: LBNRIND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.name: LBREASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that LBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: LBBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If LBDRVFL = "Y", then LBORRES may be null, with LBSTRESC and (if numeric) LBSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: LBDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTOX

datasetVariables.label: Toxicity
datasetVariables.name: LBTOX

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTOXGR

datasetVariables.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" and not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
datasetVariables.name: LBTOXGR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTPT

datasetVariables.description:
1. Text description of time when specimen should be taken.
2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See LBTPTNUM and LBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: LBTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: LBELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable LB.LBTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by LBELTM, LBTPTNUM, and LBTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: LBTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: LBRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains laboratory test data such as hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis. This domain does not include microbiology or pharmacokinetic data, which are stored in separate domains. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49592, 2018-06-29)
label: Laboratory Test Results
name: LB
